page.title: 02Afforestation
page.content: 100 years ago,Haldon Hills were a mixture of heath and beechwoods with some woodland management such a coppicing.In 1985,the woodland is primarily conifers,planted as a commercial crop.Some beeches have been retained,particularly to provide a screen in front of the dense coniferous plantations.In the last 10 years,the Forestry Commision has opened up sections of the woods for recreation, and there is also a policy of encouraging nature conservation wherever possible,by creating breaks in the forest,some pond creation and some selective planting of deciduous screen trees.
